query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.result: 1 Of new pain I must make verses 2 and give material to the twentieth canto 3 of the first song, which is of those submerged.

4 I was already completely ready 5 to look into the uncovered depth, 6 which was bathed in anguished tears;
7 and I saw people through the round valley 8 coming, silently and weeping, at the pace 9 that the litanies do in this world.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.result:
10 As my gaze descended lower upon them, 11 it appeared, marvelously, that each was reversed 12 between the chin and the beginning of the chest,
13 for the face had been turned from the loins, 14 and they had to come on backwards, 15 because seeing forward was taken from them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.

Please translate literally into English.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.result:
19 If God lets you, reader, take fruit 20 from your reading, now consider for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
22 when I saw our image so twisted up close, 23 that the tears from their eyes 24 bathed their buttocks through the crack.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”.
query.result:
25 Certainly I was weeping, leaning against one of the crags 26 of the hard cliff, so that my escort 27 said to me: “Are you still one of the other fools?
28 Here pity lives when it is truly dead; 29 who is more wicked than he 30 who endures suffering at the divine judgment?
31 Raise your head, raise it, and see to whom 32 the earth opened itself before the eyes of the Thebans; 33 for which they all cried out: “Where are you falling,
34 Amphiaraus? Why do you abandon the war?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.result:
35 And he did not stop falling down the valley 36 until Minos, who seizes everyone.
37 See how he has made a chest of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 he looks behind and goes a backward path.

40 See Tiresias, who changed appearance 41 when from male he became female, 42 all of his members being transformed;
43 and first, then, it was necessary for him to strike 44 the two entwined serpents with the rod, 45 so that he might have back his male member.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.result:
46 Aronta is he who crawls on his belly, 47 who in the mountains of Luni, where quarries 48 the man from Carrara who dwells below,
49 had his dwelling in a cave among the white marble; 50 from where his view was not cut off to watch the stars 51 and the sea.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
55 Manto fu, che cercò per terre molte; 56 poscia si puose là dove nacqu’ io; 57 onde un poco mi piace che m’ascolte.

Please translate literally into English.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.result: 58 After his father departed from life 59 and the city of Bacchus became enslaved, 60 this one wandered through the world for a long time.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.result: 61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Germany 63 above Tyrol, which has the name Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.result: 64 By a thousand springs, I believe, and more it is bathed 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennine 66 with the water that stagnates in the said lake.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.result: 67 There is a place in the middle where the Trentino 68 shepherd and the one from Brescia and the Veronese 69 could make a sign, if they made that journey.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.result: 70 Peschiera sits, a beautiful and strong fortress 71 to confront the Brescians and Bergamasques, 72 where the shore descends more around.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.result: 73 There it is necessary that all of that which 74 cannot stay in the lap of Benaco falls, 75 and becomes a river down through green pastures.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.result: 76 As soon as the water begins to run, 77 it is no longer called Benaco, but Mincio 78 all the way to Governolo, where it falls into the Po.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.

Please translate literally into English.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.

Please translate literally into English.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.result: 85 There, to flee all human company, 86 he stopped with his servants to practice his arts, 87 and he lived, and there he left his empty body.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.result: 88 Then the men who were scattered around 89 gathered at that place, which was strong 90 because of the marsh that surrounded it on all sides.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.

Please translate literally into English.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.result: 94 Its people were already more densely packed within, 95 before the madness of the Casalodi 96 received deception from Pinamonte.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.result: 97 Therefore I warn you that if you ever hear 98 my land's origin told differently, 99 let no lie deceive you from the truth.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.result: 100 And I: "Master, your words 101 are so certain to me and so gain my faith, 102 that the others would be to me like dead coals.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».

Please translate literally into English.
106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.result:
106 Then he said to me: "He who from his cheek 107 extends his beard over his brown shoulders, 108 was—when Greece was emptied of men,
109 so that scarcely any remained in the cradles— 110 an augur, and he gave the signal with Calchas 111 at Aulis to cut the first rope.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.result: 112 He was named Eurypylus, and thus my lofty tragedy 113 sings of him in some place: 114 you know it well, for you know it all.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.result: 115 That other one who is so thin in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 knew the game of magical deceptions.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.result: 118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who would now like to have paid attention to the leather and the thread, 120 but repents too late.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.

query.result:
124 But let us come now, for the sun already holds the boundary 125 of both hemispheres and touches the waves 126 beneath Seville and the thorns of Cain;
127 and already last night the moon was full: 128 you should remember it well, for it did not harm you 129 at any time through the deep forest."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.result: Thus he spoke to me, and we went on our way together.
